borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: The use shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by S.51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).

The premises shall be used for retail sales and display within Use Class A1 of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended).Reason: The site is designated for retail use by Policy SC4 of the Site Specific Allocations Development Plan Document.

The store shall not trade outside the hours of 07:00 am and 23:00 pm Monday to Saturday and 10:00 am and 18:00 pm on Sunday; the store shall not be serviced outside the hours of 06:00 am and 00:00 midnight Monday to Saturday and 09:00 am and 19:00 pm on Sunday;Reason:  To prevent the use causing any undue disturbance to occupants of neighbouring properties at unreasonable hours and in accordance with policy BP8 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.

The use shall not be begun until details of the design and location of an acoustic fence (measuring 3.0m in height) to be erected in accordance with the recommendations of the Delivery Noise Assessment by White Young Green Consulting Engineers dated January 2012, have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and the acoustic fence as approved erected.Reason:  To prevent the use causing any undue disturbance to occupants of neighbouring properties at unreasonable hours and in accordance with policy BP8 of the Local Development Framework Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.

The net sales area of the building (as defined by Annex A of the PPS4 Practice Guide) should not exceed 2,713 square metres and convenience goods should not account for more than 1,628 square metres.Reason: To protect the viability and vitality of neighbouring shopping parades and to comply with Policy BE3 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.

The building hereby permitted shall not be occupied until there has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority a Travel Plan for the site which shall be based on the submitted framework travel plan and include proposals for minimising car-borne travel and encouraging walking, cycling and the use of public transport. The Travel Plan shall include details of funding, implementation, monitoring and review. The approved Travel Plan shall be implemented and monitored in accordance with the approved scheme.Reason:  In order to encourage the use of sustainable transport and in accordance with policy BR10 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.

The development hereby permitted shall not commence until the junction improvement works approved under BrandLeonard drawing 10429/6015 dated May 2008, or such other works previously approved by the Local Planning Authority, have been completed. Reason: In order to minimise the impact of the development on the free flow of traffic on the local highway network and in the interests of highway safety and in accordance with policy BR10 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.
description: Application for variation of condition 11 in respect of planning permission 84/00546/TP3 to extend the range of goods that are permitted to be sold to allow the floorspace to be used as a foodstore.
